item.title: Rachel add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "In the sunset of dissolution, everything is illuminated by the aura of nostalgia, even the guillotine." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "Once the writer in every individual comes to life (and that time is not far off), we are in for an age of universal deafness and lack of understanding." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Rachel add a quote by E.L. Doctorow
item.description: "Writing is like driving at night in the fog. You can only see as far as your headlights, but you can make the whole trip that way." -- E.L. Doctorow

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Wally Lamb
item.description: "I started writing because of a terrible feeling of powerlessness," the novelist Anita Brookner has said. The National Book Award winner Alice McDermott noted that the most difficult thing about becoming a writer was convincing herself that she had anything to say that people would want to read. "There's nothing to writing," the columnist Red Smith once commented. "All you do is sit down at a typewriter and open a vein." -- Wally Lamb

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It's no good pretending that any relationship has a future if your record collections disagree violently or if your favorite films wouldn't even speak to each other if they met at a party." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "How do people, like, not curse? How is it possible? There are these gaps in speech where you just have to put a "fuck." I'll tell you who the most admirable people in the world are: newscasters. If that was me, I'd be like, "And the motherfuckers flew the fucking plane right into the Twin Towers." How could you not, if you're a human being? Maybe they're not so admirable. Maybe they're robot zombies." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "It seems to me now that the plain state of being human is dramatic enough for anyone; you don't need to be a heroin addict or a performance poet to experience extremity. You just have to love someone." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "Books are, let's face it, better than everything else. If we played cultural Fantasy Boxing League, and made books go 15 rounds in the ring against the best that any other art form had to offer, then books would win pretty much every time. Go on, try it. “The Magic Flute” v. Middlemarch? Middlemarch in six. “The Last Supper” v. Crime and Punishment? Fyodor on points. See? I mean, I don’t know how scientific this is, but it feels like the novels are walking it. You might get the occasional exception -– “Blonde on Blonde” might mash up The Old Curiosity Shop, say, and I wouldn’t give much for Pale Fire’s chance against Citizen Kane. And every now and again you'd get a shock, because that happens in sport, so Back to the Future III might land a lucky punch on Rabbit, Run; but I'm still backing literature 29 times out of 30." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Beatrix Potter
item.description: "Believe there is a great power silently working all things for good, behave yourself and never mind the rest." -- Beatrix Potter

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Beatrix Potter
item.description: "Thank goodness I was never sent to school; it would have rubbed off some of the originality." -- Beatrix Potter

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Rachel add a quote by The Dalai Lama
item.description: "Know the rules well, so you can break them effectively." -- The Dalai Lama

item.title: Rachel add a quote by The Dalai Lama
item.description: "If you think you are too small to make a difference, try sleeping with a mosquito." -- The Dalai Lama

item.title: Rachel add a quote by H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
item.description: "Approach love and cooking with reckless abandon" -- H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Dalai Lama XIV
item.description: "My religion is very simple. My religion is kindness." -- Dalai Lama XIV

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Shirley Jackson
item.description: "No live organism can continue for long to exist sanely under conditions of absolute reality." -- Shirley Jackson

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "America will never be destroyed from the outside. If we falter and lose our freedoms, it will be because we destroyed ourselves." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "It has been my experience that folks who have no vices have very few virtues." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Bill Keane
item.description: "Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present." -- Bill Keane

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Substitute 'damn' every time you're inclined to write 'very;' your editor will delete it and the writing will be just as it should be." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "Don't spend time beating on a wall, hoping to transform it into a door. " -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Coco Chanel
item.description: "As long as you know men are like children, you know everything!" -- Coco Chanel

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "What I want is so simple I almost can't say it: elementary kindness." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "I’ve seen how you can’t learn anything when you’re trying to look like the smartest person in the room." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place." -- Zora Neale Hurston
